revision:
• An event for an experiment is the collection of some outcomes of the experiment.
  • A set for an experiment is the collection of all the outcomes of the experiment.
  • The empirical (or experimental) probability P(E) of an event E is given by:
    \(P(E) = \frac{Number\;of\;trials\;in\;which\;E\;has\;happened}{Total\;number\;of\;trials}\)
  • The Probability of any event lies between 0 and 1 (0 and 1 inclusive).
  • If the Probability of all the events are independent, the sum of the probabilities of all the possible individual events is equal to 1
